DOC.HEAD: Abortion Protesters Arrested Posing as Clinic Clients
DOC.TEXT: Ten anti-abortion activists were arrested inside a women's health clinic after they got inside by posing as clients and then urged women to forgo abortions. Seven other supporters of the anti-abortion group Operation Rescue were arrested while demonstrating outside the Northside Women's Clinic Friday, police said. The protesters entered the clinic with a group of clients, police said. After everyone was seated, the men jumped up and began arguing against abortion. Police advised clinic employees to check the day's client list, and arrested those who didn't have appointments. Outside, other protesters sat in front of two clinic entrances. A group sang and picketed in front of the clinic, briefly blocking cars until the occupants rolled down their windows and accepted anti-abortion literature. One man was arrested after he stood in front of a car and refused to move. Chamblee Police Chief Reed Miller said those arrested, 16 adults and one 16-year-old girl, were charged with criminal trespass and were held on $220 bond each at the DeKalb County Jail. Miller said he normally releases abortion protesters after giving them a copy of the charges, but ``I feel like it's more serious this time.'' ``They were actually inside the building,'' he said. ``Something bad is going to happen. I wouldn't be surprised if one day this thing blew sky-high.'' Friday's demonstration was the third time this month that members of the group have been arrested in the Atlanta area and the second time the Northside Clinic has been targeted.
